A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

Entertainment.utils module

Entertainment.utils.category_objects(request, category_name)[source]

A function that retrieves the category queryset from the database based on its category name.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • category_name (str) – The name of the category.

Returns:

A queryset of objects for the specified category.

Return type:

QuerySet

Raises:

Http404 – If the specified category cannot be found.

Entertainment.utils.create_subcategory_object(category)[source]

Create an object for the sub-category (e.g.Music) quiz data :param category: The id of the category to retrieve questions for :type category: int

Create a function that finds the question id for the next question in the quiz.

Parameters:

response (dict) – The JSON response from the Open Trivia DB API.

Returns:

A list of category names.

list

Entertainment.utils.get_json_categories()[source]

Returns the json response for the available categories on Open Trivia DB.

Returns:

The json response from the Open Trivia DB API.

Return type:

json

Raises:

requests.RequestException – If the request to the Open Trivia DB API fails.

Entertainment.utils.get_next_question_id(category_name, question_id, question_selection_pks)[source]

A function that retrieves the next question id based on the current question id and the list of question pks.

Parameters:

  • category_name (str) – The name of the category.

  • question_id (int) – The id of the current question.

  • question_selection_pks (list) – A list of question pks.

Returns:

The id of the next question.

Return type:

int

  • category (int) – The category ID to retrieve questions for.

Entertainment.views module

Entertainment.views.detail(request, category_name, question_id)[source]

This function retrieves a question object from the database based on the question_id passed in the URL. It also retrieves the list of choices for the question and converts the choices text field into a list of dictionaries. The function passes all the context variables into a single dictionary to render in the template correctly.

Entertainment.views.index_en(request)[source]

This function is the homepage of Entertainment quizzes. It displays a list of categories of quizzes and the first question of each category. If a user prematurely leaves a quiz and does not use the exit button, the result and session data of the current quiz are deleted.

Entertainment.views.results(request, category_name: str)[source]

This function retrieves the quiz result from the session and renders the result template.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • category_name (str) – The name of the category of the quiz.

Returns:

The HTTP response object.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Entertainment.views.selection(request, category_name, question_id)[source]

This function handles the submitted data for a question in a quiz.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • category_name (str) – The name of the category of the quiz.

  • question_id (int) – The unique identifier of the question.

Returns:

The HTTP response object.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Entertainment.views.try_new_quiz(request)[source]

This function deletes the quiz result and session data of the current quiz before starting a new quiz. It then redirects the user to the home page of Entertainment quizzes.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

A redirect to the home page of Entertainment quizzes.

Return type:

HttpResponseRedirect
